questions.question: What is the purpose of passing steam over the sphalerite concentrate and lime mixture during roasting?

options.A: To cool down the reaction vessel
options.B: To reduce the concentration of zinc oxide
options.C: To oxidize the sulfide to oxide
options.D: To increase the concentration of hydrogen sulfide

questions.explanation: Steam aids in oxidizing sulfides to oxides during the roasting process.

questions.question: Which of the following reactions represents the overall reaction occurring during the roasting process?
questions.explanation: This equation represents the overall transformation of zinc sulfide to zinc oxide and calcium sulfide.

questions.question: What is the purpose of analyzing the calcine for ZnO after roasting?

options.A: To determine the purity of the lime used
options.B: To assess the concentration of zinc oxide produced
options.C: To identify any impurities in the steam
options.D: To monitor the temperature of the furnace

questions.explanation: Analyzing ZnO content confirms the success of the roasting process.

questions.question: How long is the roasting process carried out for?
questions.explanation: The roasting process is conducted for one hour

questions.question: Which compound is formed by the reaction of hydrogen sulfide with lime during the roasting process?
questions.explanation: Lime reacts with hydrogen sulfide to form calcium sulfide.
